title: Portobello Mushroom Burgers With Carrot-Cabbage Slaw
summary: The recipe Portobello Mushroom Burgers With Carrot-Cabbage Slaw is ready in approximately 10 minutes and is definitely an excellent vegan option for lovers of American food. This recipe serves 4 and costs $1.7 per serving. One portion of this dish contains roughly 7g of protein, 7g of fat, and a total of 208 calories. 1 person were glad they tried this recipe. It is perfect for The Fourth Of July. If you have carrot-cabbage slaw, salt, balsamic vinegar, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 67%. This score is solid. Try Portobello Burgers with Chipotle Avocado Slaw, Portobello Buffalo Burgers with Celery Apple Slaw, and Portobello Mushroom Burgers for similar recipes.
instructions: Scrape gills from mushroom caps with a spoon, if desired.                                                                                                 Combine vinegar, oil, and salt in a shallow dish or large zip-top plastic freezer bag; add mushrooms, turning to coat. Cover or seal, and chill 1 hour, turning occasionally. Remove mushrooms from marinade, discarding marinade.                                                                                                 Grill mushrooms, covered with grill lid, over medium-high heat (350 to 400) 3 to 4 minutes on each side or until tender.                                                                                                 Serve mushrooms on buns with slaw.                                                                                                Note: Nutritional analysis includes 1/2 cup slaw.
